page.title: 03ST.MARY HOO
page.content: St.Mary Hoo is still a farming centre. Of the sixty_odd houses in the parish, only eleven are now occupied by farm workers. St.Mary's Hall, Ross and Coombe farms, together with much of the drained marshes belong to the Church Commission. Newlands and Fenn Farms are privately owned. One of the farmhouses has been turned into a restaurant. The Parochial School, built in 1868 is now a private house as is St.Mary's Church, though the graveyard remains unaltered. There is a public house, the Fenn Bell, and a small industrial development also at Fenn. At Barn Street there is a shop and sub Post Office and a garage that does repairs but does not sell petrol any longer.
